intro: Aneilema welwitschii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, with upright stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires partial shade to flourish. Aneilema welwitschii is popular as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
